name: Leisure Time
description: After the vandalization of a beloved monument, the Bajorans seek to create a new athletic pursuit to unite their people and distract from the horrors of war. But they'll need the help of a crew versed in the diverse leisure pursuits of a vast galaxy.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Kira, EMH, or Scotty will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Kira, EMH, or Scotty
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

action.name: The Back Nine at Gedi Prime?

rewards.name: 10x Portal

goals.flavor: Employ the infinite diversity of the Federation.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "The Vedeks are fed up. Violence and crime among young Bajorans is at an all-time high. Naturally, the Vedeks want to take the fire and brimstone approach, but I think that's just going to make things worse."

"Most of these kids were born during the Occupation. They were born into a world of violence and fear. They've never known a life of peace and have no idea where to place their pent-up emotions. I sure didn't when I was their age. So we need to give them a way to channel it."

"What the Colonel is trying to say, Captain, is that she wants to create a new sport for the Bajoran people to channel all of that post-war anxiety. As a physician, I agree that sports can do wonders for one's wellbeing, even if the Bajorans aren't known for their athletics."

"You've no place to talk, hologram! Golf? Aye, that's as athletic as Andorian pottery! But that mouthy blast of photons is right. A new leisure pursuit might unite the Bajorans around something light and fun. But we could use your help researching to give us some ideas."
"This is quite the diverse batch of inspiration you've brought us here, Captain. I'd say your efforts were a hole in one."

"Ugh. Proud of that humor, are you, hologram? I miss the days when the ship's computer just executed the essential functions without trying to be funny. Anyway, this is a nice spread you've brought us."

responses.text: "The tradition surrounding the sport is most important."
"The teamwork a sport can teach is paramount."

screens.text: "Yes, there's definitely a lot here to work with. Well, Captain, what do you think is the most important aspect of a sport?"
"Precisely. And the sport needn't even require a great deal of exertion, like football or running. Look at me. I play golf, a subdued gentleman's game, and I'm the picture of an impeccable physique."
"Your physique is as good a justification for golf as mine is for Klingon opera."

"This is the angle that will resonate most with my people. Tradition, or even the relief of seeing hints of the old Bajor, got so many people through. Maybe creating a new tradition surrounding a sport that's all our own will help them take their next step into the future."
"I've gotta agree with you there, Captain. Does you good your whole life through too, learning to get along with others and work together."

"Maybe it would help narrow some of these ideas down if we focus on that one aspect. Captain, do you think we could get you to do a little more research for us? Maybe poke around and get some more specifics?"
